author: Lawrence Hurley
description: In a separate action, the court decided against taking up an election case involving mail-in ballots in Pennsylvania that pitted Republicans against Democrats.
title: Supreme Court leaves in place District of Columbia's gun restriction on large magazines

author: Andrew Blankstein
description: LOS ANGELES — Federal immigration authorities raided “multiple locations” throughout the city Friday, officials said, in action that drew an immediate rebuke from area officials and a distanced response from local law enforcement
title: Immigration officials target multiple Los Angeles sites

author: Erik Ortiz
description: A former girlfriend of Diddy’s going by the pseudonym “Jane” wept on the witness stand today as she described drug-induced sexual encounters with male escorts while she traveled the world with the music mogul.
title: 'Jane' gives tearful testimony about 'hotel nights' at Diddy's direction

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Grant Hardin, a former Arkansas police chief convicted of rape and murder, was captured Friday after escaping from prison nearly two weeks ago.
title: Ex-police chief convicted of rape and murder captured after escaping Arkansas prison

author: Reuters
description: The AP sued after the White House restricted its access over continued references to the Gulf of Mexico in its coverage despite Trump renaming the body of water the Gulf of America.
title: Trump can bar The Associated Press from some White House events for now, appeals court rules

author: David K. Li
description: Los Angeles took a huge step toward linking airplanes to trains on Friday, as the nation's fifth busiest hub joined the modern travel world and offered car-loving Southern Californians an off-ramp from traffic-clogged freeways
title: Rail access arrives at Los Angeles International Airport

author: Sahil Kapur
description: Thirteen House Republicans who voted for President Donald Trump's "big, beautiful bill" sent a letter Friday urging Senate GOP leaders to scale back some of its clean energy cuts, sparking pushback from conservative hardliners.
title: 13 House Republicans urge Senate to scale back clean energy cuts in bill they voted for

author: The Politics Desk
description: The feud between Elon Musk and President Donald Trump erupted yesterday in an epic clash — and it’s not clear yet where the confrontation will go next.
title: What comes next in the Trump-Musk feud: From the Politics Desk

description: NBC News White House Correspondent Vaughn Hillyard sat down with Education Secretary Linda McMahon for an exclusive interview where she defended the administration’s policy toward elite universities like Harvard and Columbia
title: Education Secretary defends Trump administration pressure on universities

author: The Associated Press
description: Top-ranked Jannik Sinner beat Novak Djokovic 6-4, 7-5, 7-6 (3) on Friday to set up a French Open final against defending champion Carlos Alcaraz
title: French Open: Sinner beats Djokovic to set up final against defending champion Alcaraz

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The dispute concerns efforts by the Department of Government Efficiency, largely led by Elon Musk, to access sensitive data, including Social Security numbers.
title: Supreme Court allows DOGE to access Social Security data

author: Julie Tsirkin
description: WASHINGTON — In just a few short months, Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
title: How RFK Jr. is quickly changing U.S. health agencies

description: Attorney General Pam Bondi announced that Kilmar Abrego Garcia will be returning from El Salvador to the United States to face federal charges.
title: Bondi: Abrego Garcia will return to U.S. to face federal charges

author: Ben Kamisar
description: Four years ago, a chorus of fellow New York Democrats called on then-Gov. Andrew Cuomo to resign amid sexual harassment allegations. Now, a growing group of them are endorsing him for mayor of New York City.
title: Democrats who called on Andrew Cuomo to resign in 2021 are endorsing him in 2025

author: Doha Madani
description: Volleyball has been a source of joy for Aly Torline, shaping her from a kid in club leagues to collegiate athlete.
title: These former college athletes were told a coach may have hacked into their private photos

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: Game 1 of the NBA Finals could have been an especially crushing defeat for a young Oklahoma City Thunder team had they not dealt with nearly the exact same scenario earlier in these same playoffs
title: The pressure is on the Thunder, but Oklahoma City has been here before

author: Tom Costello
description: An upcoming Netflix documentary reveals new details about the 2023 Titan submersible, which was traveling to the wreck of the Titanic when it imploded, killing all five people aboard.
title: New details about 2023 Titan submersible implosion revealed in Netflix documentary

author: Jo Yurcaba
description: The National Park Service has closed Washington D.C.'s historic Dupont Circle Park ahead of the final weekend of WorldPride.
title: National Park Service closes D.C.’s historic Dupont Circle Park during WorldPride

author: Viola Flowers
description: What began as a fist fight at a high school graduation in Michigan on Tuesday has turned into a search for a 20-year-old suspect in what officials are calling a prevented mass shooting attempt.
title: 'Mass shooting' thwarted at Michigan high school graduation; one suspect arrested, another at large

author: Albinson Linares
description: Aracely Serrano Ayala said she felt her world was ending several times in the last three months.
title: U.S. Salvadoran family's tough journey to Canada: 'We didn't want to be deported'

author: Erik Ortiz
description: A former federal inmate who was pardoned by President Donald Trump in his first term for drug trafficking crimes more than two decades ago has been tapped as deputy director of the federal Bureau of Prisons.
title: Former federal inmate pardoned by Trump tapped as Bureau of Prisons deputy director

author: Evan Bush
description: A congressional tour of the National Weather Service Quad Cities forecasting office revealed a skeleton crew trying to keep its crucial work going.
title: A crucial NWS office, battered by cuts, is trying to put on a brave face as tornado season peaks

author: Joe Murphy
description: Half as many crowdsourced Community Notes were created in May than were created in January.
title: Use of Community Notes on Elon Musk's X has plummeted in 2025

author: Leslie Josephs, CNBC
description: Boeing’s airplane deliveries to China will resume next month after handovers were paused amid a trade war with the Trump administration, CEO Kelly Ortberg said Thursday, as he brushed off the impact of tit-for-tat tariffs with some of the United States’ largest trading partners this year
title: Boeing to resume airplane deliveries to China next month, ramp up Max production, CEO says

author: Vaughn Hillyard
description: Education Secretary Linda McMahon on Friday defended President Donald Trump's attacks on elite universities like Harvard and Columbia, while saying that she is seeing "progress" from the institutions on the administration's demands."I have seen progress.
title: Linda McMahon says there's been 'progress' from Harvard and Columbia amid Trump's attacks

author: Marina E. Franco
description: In Wyoming, Idaho and Alabama, Atelier Ortega's Oscar Ortega, Salvador Alamila's Amano Restaurant and José Medina Camacho's bar Adiõs have earned them prestigious 2025 James Beard nominations.
title: These Latino restaurateurs in unlikely places are nominated for a prestigious culinary prize

author: The Associated Press
description: As transgender service members face a deadline to leave the U.S. military, hundreds are taking the financial bonus to depart voluntarily. But others say they will stay and fight.
title: Transgender troops face a deadline and a difficult decision: Stay or go?

author: Mirna Alsharif
description: An executor of the estate for Miranda Corsette, a 16-year-old Florida girl who police say was kidnapped, tortured and killed by a man and his girlfriend in February after meeting on a dating application, is suing Grindr for what is alleged to be their role in the murder.
title: Executor of estate for slain Florida teen sues Grindr for failing to protect minors

author: Michela Wrong
description: Rwanda and Congo war: Rwanda covert battles amid Trump's push for peace
title: Hidden invasion: Rwanda's covert war in the Congo

author: The Associated Press
description: Defending champion Carlos Alcaraz reached the French Open final on Friday after Lorenzo Musetti retired from their semifinal early in the fourth set.
title: Carlos Alcaraz reaches French Open final after Lorenzo Musetti retires with injury

author: Viola Flowers
description: A critically missing person alert has been issued for Angelina Petra Resendiz, a 21-year-old sailor last seen on the morning of May 29 at her barracks at the Naval Station Norfolk.
title: 21-year-old sailor Angelina Resendiz goes missing from Navy barracks in Virginia

description: NBC News exclusively obtained 3 years of classified intelligence reports, surveillance footage and leaked military documents revealing the extent of Rwanda’s secret war.
title: Hidden Invasion: Inside Rwanda's covert war in eastern Congo

author: The Associated Press
description: President Donald Trump’s pick to be the next U.S. surgeon general has repeatedly said the nation’s medical, health and food systems are corrupted by special interests and people out to make a profit at the expense of Americans’ health.
title: Trump's surgeon general pick criticizes others' conflicts but profits from wellness product sales

author: Chloe Atkins
description: Mahmoud Khalil, a Columbia University student detained in March by immigration agents, responded for the first time to the charges against him and described the "irreparable harm" his arrest has had on him and his family.
title: Mahmoud Khalil responds to 'grotesque' charges in new legal filing, says arrest caused 'irreparable harm'

author: Linda Carroll
description: Scientists have long been trying to discover whether the popular supplement taurine can slow aging. A new study raises questions about the nutrient for longevity.
title: Is the nutrient taurine really a key to healthy aging?

author: Kristen Welker
description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump will not be calling billionaire Elon Musk on Friday after their feud exploded into public, White House chief of staff Susie Wiles said.
title: 'No plans' for a Trump-Musk call to tamp down their feud, White House chief of staff says

description: The U.S. economy added 139,000 jobs in May, higher than expected, and the unemployment rate held steady at 4.2%. Editor-in-chief at Investopedia, Caleb Silver, breaks down the latest economic data.
title: U.S. economy adds 139,000 jobs in May while unemployment rate holds steady

author: Mithil Aggarwal
description: Space is growing emptier one star at a time. That's because 80 billion lightyears from Earth, three cosmic beasts are eating stars the size of ten suns.
title: These cosmic monsters are creating the biggest explosions since the big bang

description: The solicitor general argued that earlier ruling blocking the layoffs encroaches on the president's authority to run federal agencies.
title: Trump administration asks Supreme Court to allow Education Department firings

description: "Jane" broke down describing encounters with sex partners during alleged "hotel nights" that she said could go on for multiple rounds.
title: Sean Combs denied requests to wear condoms, ex-girlfriend says

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Trump and Musk's falling out. Pro-wresting fight night in China. Jobs data could reflect economic stability. Planned Parenthood clinics fear closures.
title: Donald Trump and Elon Musk's public feud and Planned Parenthood funding threats: Morning Rundown

author: Sahil Kapur
description: From centrists worried about Medicaid cuts to conservative hard-liners demanding steeper spending reductions, Senate GOP leaders face a tricky balancing act.
title: 7 senators to watch as Republicans make changes to Trump's big bill

author: Kaitlin Sullivan
description: Citing deep funding cuts, at least 200 Planned Parenthood clinics nationwide are at risk.
title: Planned Parenthood provides basic health care. If they close, where will many women go?

author: The Associated Press
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Thursday that Israel has “activated” some clans of Palestinians in Gaza that are opposed to Hamas, though it was not immediately clear what role they would play.
title: Israel has 'activated' some Palestinian clans opposed to Hamas in Gaza, Netanyahu says

author: Janis Mackey Frayer
description: American-style professional wrestling is gaining new fans in China, where Chinese history and music are woven into standard pro wrestling fare.
title: With kung fu kicks and dragon masks, pro wrestlers find new fans at fight night in China

author: Andrew Greif
description: The Pacers authored a third consecutive stunning series-opening victory on the road by remaining cool in the clutch.
title: The Pacers showed a rare weakness. They won by relying on their biggest strength

author: Adam Edelman
description: Winsome Earle-Sears, the de facto Republican nominee in the Virginia governor’s race, has built the early stages of her campaign around being Gov. Glenn Youngkin’s partner.
title: Earle-Sears' record on social issues complicates bid to follow Youngkin's path in Virginia governor's race

author: Rob Wile
description: Signs are growing that President Donald Trump’s unprecedented tariffs strategy is starting to take a bigger bite out of the U.S. economy.
title: Jobs data from May could show mostly stable economy, but tariff effects are emerging elsewhere

author: The Associated Press
description: The Trump administration is slapping sanctions on four judges at the International Criminal Court over the tribunal’s investigation into alleged war crimes by Israel.
title: U.S. hits International Criminal Court judges with sanctions over investigation into Israel

author: The Associated Press
description: Strawberry, Blueberry, JoJo and Mazzy were about 6 weeks old when animal rescuers coaxed them out of long metal pipes in the parking lot of a storage unit company.
title: Welcome to kitten season, when animal shelters need all the help they can get

author: The Associated Press
description: A Los Angeles sheriff's deputy will serve four months in prison on a misdemeanor conviction for using excessive force after the new Trump-appointed U.S. attorney offered an unusual plea deal despite a jury convicting him of a felony.
title: Officer who used excessive force allowed to plead guilty to misdemeanor after felony conviction

description: PHOENIX — Rookie Lexi Held scored a season-high 24 points, Satou Sabally had 19 points, seven rebounds and five assists and the Phoenix Mercury closed on an 18-1 run to beat the Golden State Valkyries 86-77 on Thursday night.
title: Rookie Lexi Held scores season-high 24 points as Mercury close on 18-1 run to beat Valkyries 86-77

author: The Associated Press
description: A private lunar lander from Japan crashed while attempting a touchdown Friday, the latest casualty in the commercial rush to the moon
title: Private lunar lander from Japan crashes into moon in failed mission

author: Madison Lambert
description: A 19-year-old man was arrested Wednesday after a Connecticut State Police trooper observed him driving at a speed later confirmed to be 132 mph
title: Man driving 132 mph told trooper he was late for a job interview

author: Reuters
description: Paramount Global chair Shari Redstone was diagnosed with thyroid cancer earlier this spring, a spokesperson for Redstone said in a statement to Reuters on Thursday
title: Paramount chair Shari Redstone confirms thyroid cancer diagnosis

description: Rodgers agrees to a one-year deal.
title: Steelers sign Aaron Rodgers, pending a physical

author: Jocelyn Shek
description: President Donald Trump’s proclamation Wednesday restricting entry into the United States for nationals from a patchwork of 19 countries revives one of his most controversial policies from his first term and targets many of the same countries
title: Trump’s travel ban, in five charts

author: The Associated Press
description: KYIV, Ukraine — Ukraine was under an ongoing Russian ballistic missile and drone attack early Friday that wounded at least three people, officials said
title: Ukraine under ongoing Russian missile and drone attack that has wounded at least 3

author: Frank Thorp V
description: As they look for additional savings, GOP senators have discussed the possibility of cutting Medicare spending they consider to be "waste, fraud and abuse" — with Trump's blessing.
title: Senate Republicans open the door to cutting Medicare 'waste' in Trump agenda bill

description: The Steelers wanted him.
title: Steelers got what they wanted, even if many fans are dismayed
